title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 11 §§ 151-3.3 - Employer safety incentive program credits
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 11 §§ 151-3.3 - Employer safety incentive program credits

State Regulations

For each policy of workers' compensation insurance issued or renewed in the State, an insurer shall provide credit to an insured employer that implements and maintains a safety incentive program, which meets the requirements of Industrial Code Rule 60. The credit shall be: (a) four percent in the first full year in which the insured is entitled to a credit; and
(b) two percent in each consecutive full year thereafter. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 11
§§
151-3.3

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
